Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant and describe what it needs to live, which includes water and light.
The student can draw a plant without water and show how it looks different from a healthy plant.
The student can illustrate how plants cannot live or grow without water by showing the differences between well-watered and dry plants.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to explain why water is vital for plant growth.
The student can include observations or examples from real life or media in their illustrations to demonstrate plants' needs.
